info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 1:32PM PST until December 24 at 4:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected, mostly above 8000 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches possible between 8000 and 9500 feet with most of the accumulation occuring overnight. Higher amounts possible above 9500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Spring Mountains, including Lee Canyon to the Mount Charleston Summit. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Roadways above 8000 feet could see significant snowfall accumulations resulting in hazardous travel conditions. Heavy snow and gusty winds could also result in very low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will fall from 9500 feet to 8000 feet by early Friday morning. Snow levels will continue to lower below 7000 feet during the morning hours and could result in minor accumulations between 7000 and 8000 feet. However, majority of precipitation expected below 8000 feet is expected to be rainfall.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
